verses.text: And it came to pass after \w this|strong="H0310"\w*, that the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Ammon|strong="H5983"\w* \w died|strong="H4191"\w*, and \w Hanun|strong="H2586"\w* his \w son|strong="H1121"\w* \w reigned|strong="H4427"\w* in his stead.

Then \w said|strong="H0559"\w* \w David|strong="H1732"\w*, I will \w shew|strong="H6213"\w* \w kindness|strong="H2617"\w* unto \w Hanun|strong="H2586"\w* the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Nahash|strong="H5176"\w*, as his \w father|strong="H0001"\w* \w shewed|strong="H6213"\w* \w kindness|strong="H2617"\w* unto me. And \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* to \w comfort|strong="H5162"\w* him by the \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* of his \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* for his \w father|strong="H0001"\w*. And \w David’s|strong="H1732"\w* \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* \w came|strong="H0935"\w* into the \w land|strong="H0776"\w* of the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Ammon|strong="H5983"\w*.

And the \w princes|strong="H8269"\w* of the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Ammon|strong="H5983"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto \w Hanun|strong="H2586"\w* their \w lord|strong="H0113"\w*, \w Thinkest|strong="H5869"\w* thou that \w David|strong="H1732"\w* doth \w honour|strong="H3513"\w* thy \w father|strong="H0001"\w*, that he hath \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* \w comforters|strong="H5162"\w* unto thee? hath not \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \add rather\add* \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* his \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* unto thee, \w to|strong="H5668"\w* \w search|strong="H2713"\w* the \w city|strong="H5892"\w*, and to spy it \w out|strong="H7270"\w*, and to \w overthrow|strong="H2015"\w* it?\f + \fr 10.3 \ft Thinkest…: Heb. In thine eyes doth David\f*

Wherefore \w Hanun|strong="H2586"\w* \w took|strong="H3947"\w* \w David’s|strong="H1732"\w* \w servants|strong="H5650"\w*, and shaved \w off|strong="H1548"\w* the one \w half|strong="H2677"\w* of their \w beards|strong="H2206"\w*, and cut \w off|strong="H3772"\w* their \w garments|strong="H4063"\w* in the \w middle|strong="H2677"\w*, \add even\add* to their \w buttocks|strong="H8357"\w*, and sent them \w away|strong="H7971"\w*.

When they \w told|strong="H5046"\w* \add it\add* unto \w David|strong="H1732"\w*, he \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* to \w meet|strong="H7125"\w* them, because the \w men|strong="H0582"\w* were \w greatly|strong="H3966"\w* \w ashamed|strong="H3637"\w*: and the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, \w Tarry|strong="H3427"\w* at \w Jericho|strong="H3405"\w* until your \w beards|strong="H2206"\w* be \w grown|strong="H6779"\w*, and \add then\add* \w return|strong="H7725"\w*.

¶ And when the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Ammon|strong="H5983"\w* \w saw|strong="H7200"\w* that they \w stank|strong="H0887"\w* before \w David|strong="H1732"\w*, the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Ammon|strong="H5983"\w* \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* and \w hired|strong="H7936"\w* the \w Syrians|strong="H0758"\w* of \w Beth-rehob|strong="H1050"\w*, and the \w Syrians|strong="H0758"\w* of \w Zoba|strong="H6678"\w*, \w twenty|strong="H6242"\w* \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w* \w footmen|strong="H7273"\w*, and of \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w Maacah|strong="H4601"\w* a \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w* \w men|strong="H0376"\w*, and of \w Ish-tob|strong="H0382"\w* \w twelve|strong="H6240"\w* \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w* \w men|strong="H0376"\w*.\f + \fr 10.6 \ft Ish-tob: or, the men of Tob\f*

And when \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w heard|strong="H8085"\w* of \add it\add*, he \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w*, and all the \w host|strong="H6635"\w* of the mighty \w men|strong="H1368"\w*.

And the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Ammon|strong="H5983"\w* came \w out|strong="H3318"\w*, and put the \w battle|strong="H4421"\w* in \w array|strong="H6186"\w* at the entering \w in|strong="H6607"\w* of the \w gate|strong="H8179"\w*: and the \w Syrians|strong="H0758"\w* of \w Zoba|strong="H6678"\w*, and of \w Rehob|strong="H7340"\w*, and \w Ish-tob|strong="H0382"\w*, and \w Maacah|strong="H4601"\w*, \add were\add* by \w themselves|strong="H0905"\w* in the \w field|strong="H7704"\w*.

When \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w* \w saw|strong="H7200"\w* that the \w front|strong="H6440"\w* of the \w battle|strong="H4421"\w* was against him \w before|strong="H6440"\w* and \w behind|strong="H0268"\w*, he \w chose|strong="H0977"\w* of all the \w choice|strong="H0977"\w* \add men\add* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*, and put \add them\add* in \w array|strong="H6186"\w* \w against|strong="H7125"\w* the \w Syrians|strong="H0758"\w*:

And the \w rest|strong="H3499"\w* of the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* he \w delivered|strong="H5414"\w* into the \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* of \w Abishai|strong="H0052"\w* his \w brother|strong="H0251"\w*, that he might put \add them\add* in \w array|strong="H6186"\w* \w against|strong="H7125"\w* the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Ammon|strong="H5983"\w*.

And he \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, If the \w Syrians|strong="H0758"\w* be too \w strong|strong="H2388"\w* for me, then thou shalt \w help|strong="H3444"\w* me: but if the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Ammon|strong="H5983"\w* be too \w strong|strong="H2388"\w* for thee, then I will \w come|strong="H1980"\w* and \w help|strong="H3467"\w* thee.

Be of good \w courage|strong="H2388"\w*, and let us play the \w men|strong="H2388"\w* for our \w people|strong="H5971"\w*, and for the \w cities|strong="H5892"\w* of our \w God|strong="H0430"\w*: and the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \w do|strong="H6213"\w* that which \w seemeth|strong="H5869"\w* him \w good|strong="H2896"\w*.

And \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w* drew \w nigh|strong="H5066"\w*, and the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* that \add were\add* with him, unto the \w battle|strong="H4421"\w* against the \w Syrians|strong="H0758"\w*: and they \w fled|strong="H5127"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* him.

And when the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Ammon|strong="H5983"\w* \w saw|strong="H7200"\w* that the \w Syrians|strong="H0758"\w* were \w fled|strong="H5127"\w*, then \w fled|strong="H5127"\w* they also \w before|strong="H6440"\w* \w Abishai|strong="H0052"\w*, and \w entered|strong="H0935"\w* into the \w city|strong="H5892"\w*. So \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w* \w returned|strong="H7725"\w* from the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Ammon|strong="H5983"\w*, and \w came|strong="H0935"\w* to \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*.

¶ And when the \w Syrians|strong="H0758"\w* \w saw|strong="H7200"\w* that they were \w smitten|strong="H5062"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*, they \w gathered|strong="H0622"\w* themselves \w together|strong="H3162"\w*.

And \w Hadarezer|strong="H1928"\w* \w sent|strong="H7971"\w*, and brought \w out|strong="H3318"\w* the \w Syrians|strong="H0758"\w* that \add were\add* \w beyond|strong="H5676"\w* the \w river|strong="H5104"\w*: and they \w came|strong="H0935"\w* to \w Helam|strong="H2431"\w*; and \w Shobach|strong="H7731"\w* the \w captain|strong="H8269"\w* of the \w host|strong="H6635"\w* of \w Hadarezer|strong="H1928"\w* \add went\add* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* them.\f + \fr 10.16 \ft the river: that is, Euphrates\f*\f + \fr 10.16 \ft Shobach: or, Shophach\f*

And when it was \w told|strong="H5046"\w* \w David|strong="H1732"\w*, he \w gathered|strong="H0622"\w* all \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w* \w together|strong="H0622"\w*, and passed \w over|strong="H5674"\w* \w Jordan|strong="H3383"\w*, and \w came|strong="H0935"\w* to \w Helam|strong="H2431"\w*. And the \w Syrians|strong="H0758"\w* set themselves in \w array|strong="H6186"\w* \w against|strong="H7125"\w* \w David|strong="H1732"\w*, and \w fought|strong="H3898"\w* with him.

And the \w Syrians|strong="H0758"\w* \w fled|strong="H5127"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*; and \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w slew|strong="H2026"\w* \add the men of\add* \w seven|strong="H7651"\w* \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w chariots|strong="H7393"\w* of the \w Syrians|strong="H0758"\w*, and \w forty|strong="H0705"\w* \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w* \w horsemen|strong="H6571"\w*, and \w smote|strong="H5221"\w* \w Shobach|strong="H7731"\w* the \w captain|strong="H8269"\w* of their \w host|strong="H6635"\w*, who \w died|strong="H4191"\w* there.\f + \fr 10.18 \ft horsemen: also called, footmen\f*

And when all the \w kings|strong="H4428"\w* \add that were\add* \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* to \w Hadarezer|strong="H1928"\w* \w saw|strong="H7200"\w* that they were \w smitten|strong="H5062"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*, they made \w peace|strong="H7999"\w* with \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*, and \w served|strong="H5647"\w* them. So the \w Syrians|strong="H0758"\w* \w feared|strong="H3372"\w* to \w help|strong="H3467"\w* the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Ammon|strong="H5983"\w* any more.
